searchParameters.q: how much are old crocks worth

answerBox.snippet: Five-gallon, salt-glazed, hand-painted crocks with handles can sell from $200 to $1250. This vast range in price depends greatly on the particular item's condition and whether or not it has its original manufacturer's marks.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What can I do with vintage crocks?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
DECORATING IDEAS FOR VINTAGE CROCKS
use it as a vase and put a big stem of pussy willows or large faux greenery in it
as a caddy for kitchen utensils, such as wooden spoons next to the stove
put firewood or kindling in a large one next to the fireplace
a collection spot for dog toys!
as shoe storage in the entryway
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Decorating Ideas for Vintage Crocks - The Antiqued Journey

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much is a 40 gallon crock worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: The 40 Gallon Crock has an estimated value on the secondary retail market for an of average of $175.00-250.00, depending on the condition and where it is for sale at. These will typically sell higher in an Antique Shop or Private sale compared to an auction.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: I have a 40 gallon crock that I would like to get a value for ... - JustAnswer

peopleAlsoAsk.question: What do numbers on crocks mean?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Crocks were used as measures and made in many different sizes. The number marks the size; this one holds three gallons.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much is stoneware worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Examples of Rare Stoneware Jugs While most antique stoneware jugs sell for around $200 to $300, a few rare pieces sometimes appear that have remarkable value. For instance, Morphy Auctions in Pennsylvania listed the below rare stoneware jug as having a value between $7000 and $10,000.
